news.title: Luxury credit card rivalry heats up as Amex, JPMorgan tease updates to their premier cards
news.summary: The long-running rivalry between the country's top premium credit cards is about to heat up again. The two banks have been at odds for more than a decade.

news.title: Trump Organization announces mobile plan, $499 smartphone
news.summary: President Donald Trump and his businesses have rolled out numerous products during his political career, including watches, sneakers and Bibles. Trump's businesses have also rolled out watches, shoes, Bibles and other products.

news.title: Meta is finally bringing ads to WhatsApp
news.summary: Meta's plans to make WhatsApp a big business involve online ads. It's a major change for the communications app whose previous owners shunned advertising.

news.title: U.S. Steel shares rally as Trump approves Nippon takeover with unique government 'golden share'
news.summary: U.S. Steel and Japan's Nippon Steel said Trump had approved their merger. They signed a national security agreement with the U.S., the companies said.

news.title: Suspect Vance Boelter apprehended in Minnesota lawmakers shooting case
news.summary: Minnesota Democratic state Rep. Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark, were killed. Boelter allegedly killed Hortman in what appears to be a politically motivated shooting.

news.title: My mother-in-law, 95, has $400K in stocks. Would it be smarter taxwise to gift it to her kids — or leave it to them in her will?
news.summary: “What is the smartest way to go about this? Will she be taxed?” he asks. “What are the best ways to deal with this?’

news.title: ‘I’m 68 and my 401(k) has dwindled to $82,000’: My husband committed financial infidelity and has $50,000 in credit-card debt. What now?
news.summary: “I have $3,000 in gold and Social Security income for me and my spouse makes $46,180 a year.”

news.title: Deutsche Bank says looming tariff deadline and this other risk are what investors should care about now
news.summary: Deutsche Bank says worry about a looming tariff deadline and inflation. Deutsche Bank: Concerns over looming tariffs and inflation are overblown. Bank says it is not worried about the threat of inflation.

news.title: Jaguar’s widely mocked branding campaign did boost interest, company says
news.summary: Jaguar's relaunch, targeted at a younger audience, did generate attention. Jaguar’s widely mocked relaunch was aimed at a young audience.

news.title: Israel-Iran conflict poses three challenges for stocks that could slam market by up to 20%, warns RBC
news.summary: Spiking oil prices may muddle the Federal Reserve’s inflation forecasts. The Federal Reserve's inflation forecasts are based on an inflation rate of 2.4 percent.
